intro: Lasallea novae-angliae, commonly known as the New England lasallea, is a rare and endemic species native to specific regions of New England. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate inflorescences. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as woodlands and streamside areas. Its leaves are finely divided and have a distinctive, delicate appearance. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in conservation efforts.
